Seminal.Explain: Women are not really exposed to information and unable to access it.
Possible Solutions: Promoting women to position of the same qualifications as men, capacity building and women empowerment.
Consequence of less awareness for women: Underdevelopment and illiteracy.
Rights.Please Explain: If women are empowered from all of the above, will feel protected and inclusive.
Econ.Please Explain: All of the above will be able to help women live a better life.
Anything Else: Women should be considered in all sphere of life to enhance their economic status base on them accessing information at an easy rate, frequency and success as men.
Enumerator Notes: The respondents including this, from the ministry of Agriculture were afraid of giving their names and phone numbers to be recorded because of lack of confidence, though we explained to them that it will not be published.

Seminal.Explain: Because they do not allow easily for women to access any information. They think men should always be on top of any situation.
Original Barrier 3: Confidence to ask Government for information/self esteem.
Possible Solutions: Government should give priority to women in any organization and they should also advocate for more job institution to grow.
Consequence of less awareness for women: Due to fear, mostly some women do not have time to check or care about anything. This will leads to more domestic violence against them.
Rights.Please Explain: Women should access all this right because they should feel secure secure in any other places and will help them to grow.
Econ.Please Explain: To inspire other women not to feel insecure of themselves to achieve their goals, all the information are valuable.
Original Second Most Important: How to get a trade license.
Second Most Important: How to Get a Trade License
Anything Else: Women should be encouraged and educated about their rights and benefits in accessing it.
Enumerator Notes: Women should be encouraged to head top offices .

Seminal.Explain: No woman is discriminated in any office.
Possible Solutions: Education, translation of documents and confidence building programs in women should be organized for women .
Consequence of less awareness for women: It will leads to wrong information to the public.
Rights.Please Explain: They are all valuable
Econ.Please Explain: These can help in women empowerment and hence enhance their economic positively.
Anything Else: No
Enumerator Notes: Little confrontation was encountered at the starting.

Seminal.Explain: We all access it the same way, infact most times they are given more priority.
Original Barrier 3: Confidence to ask Government for information.

Consequence of less awareness for women: Gender base violence against them.
Rights.Please Explain: They all work for the right of women.
Econ.Please Explain: They can help them get money
Anything Else: It is good for women to access information to improve on their rights
Enumerator Notes: The attitude of the respondent was too bad in giving the information.

Seminal.Explain: Some women are being discriminated or advantaged because they are women.
Original Barrier 1: Don't know how/where to ask for information
Possible Solutions: Inclusive education, Sensitization/awareness campaign, and boost confidence in women through engagements, radio programs etc.
Consequence of less awareness for women: They will always face challenges with regards domestic violence and other forms of abuse against women.
Rights.Please Explain: For women to access their rights and be free of all forms of abuse.
Econ.Please Explain: For women's self confidence building and economic empowerment.
Anything Else: Self sufficiency eradicates financial constrains.

Seminal.Explain: Educated women are in the minority so the uneducated are afraid to ask for access to this information and even if they ask the educated men will create a bottleneck in providing such information to them with consideration of our cultural and societal belief.
Issue.Other Explain: The high rate of illiteracy with our women in Sierra Leone backed with the cultural beliefs system and the awareness of the place to get the right information are the key barriers.
Original Barrier 1: Most of the time they don't know where to get access to the appropriate information.
Original Barrier 2: Because of the high rate of illiteracy with women in Sierra Leone, they lack the self esteem to ask for the required information they need.
Original Barrier 3: Our cultural beliefs also play a key role in why our women are afraid to ask for information.
Possible Solutions: Capacity building for our women, awareness raising on access to information and bringing the information base closer to the communities.
Consequence of less awareness for women: It will continue to put them behind the scenes and they will be seen as drop out for which they will not be in the capacity to capacitate their children and as a result will have negative impact on the country as a whole.
Rights.Please Explain: All of these rights are very important and if only our women will know them and what to do if someone violates them  then we will be a progressive nation as we all partners in development.
Econ.Please Explain: Economic empowerment for our women will help the family more than the men as women pay more attention to their kids and if empowered financially, the kids will be safe and educated for which the nation will be alleviated out of poverty.
Anything Else: They need the access to information now.

Name of Organization: Center for Advocacy and Sustainable Empowerment (CASE-Salone)
Seminal.Explain: We have more men working for government than women. This has created the structural imbalance where men access more information on issues related to governance than Women.
Original Barrier 1: Don't know where to ask for information
Possible Solutions:
1. Increase awareness among women for them to know that they have the right to access information

2. Sensitize pubic officials to share information with wonen
Consequence of less awareness for women: There ability to participate in decision making processes will be limited
Rights.Please Explain: Women suffer discrimination the most in our society, and this is wide spread today. Therefore, allowing them to access information that will help them overcome this challenge will be important. Further, knowing how the justice system works in the country will help women to fearlessly defend their rights.
Econ.Please Explain: Giving women vocational training is a more sustainable approach to helping them over economic challenges they are faced with, and this will be boosted by providing entrepreneurship opportunities for them.
Original Most Important: Anti discrimination and equality for women;
Original Second Most Important: Information on how to access information on entrepreneurship and skills training for women;
Original Third Most Important: Providing information on how women can get job opportunities.
Anything Else: Women have less access to information because they are they are few in the decision making processes in the country.

Econ.Please Explain: It will help them to be empowered

Name of Organization: Ministry of Labour and Social Security

Original Barrier 3: Women are seen more as  people who should engage in domestic to upkeep the home and as a result they are not bother to access information or their domestic duties far outweigh their quest to access the necessary information

Consequence of less awareness for women: It will result in recurrence of issues women face in the Country

Seminal.Explain: A lot of women are house wives. Men are disproportionately represented in the public sector. There are more literate men than women.
Issue.Other: Customary rule which restrict the movement of women without permission - small barrier
Issue.Other Explain:
Do not know where to go for information
Domestic duties 
Mindset of government officials
Original Barrier 1: It is a big challenge regarding where to access Information. People find them being referred from one government MDA to the other.
Original Barrier 2: Domestic duties are a huge burden on women. This leaves them with limited time and energy to source information.
Original Barrier 3:
Government officials do not like giving out information as though they have something to hide.
In a society where corruption is rife in the public sector, there is resistance on the part of public servant to give out information.
They hide behind socalled 'oath of secrecy' to deny people information.
Possible Solutions:
Information should be given out through several channels particularly through places of workshop and community based and civil society organizations. The government should not wait for people to ask for information. 
There should be a deadline within which public officials should give out information.
Public officials can be very rude to the public especially women. They are mostly nice when you have money to offer them or bribe to offer. They should be trained on customer service skills.
Consequence of less awareness for women:
It affects growth in the family and the nation
It will worsen human rights and reproductive health issues
Affects the participation of women in socio economic development and democracy.
Rights.Please Explain: The most valuation information is one bordering on the right to education. Once we are able to get our women educated they will be able to assert their rights. They will be less prone to abuses including domestic violence.
Econ.Please Explain: When you develop the human resource everything is possible. They will know and assert their rights, tap opportunities and participate effectively in the socio economic and political development.
Original Third Most Important: How to start a business SME
Anything Else: n/a
Enumerator Notes: I spent a lot more time than I had expected.

Type.Describe Other: Prejudice against women in leadership roles.
Seminal.Explain: Of course women have ample access to information same as men. The country maintains a law that provides their rights to access information for all it's citizens (both men and women). We recently signed a bill extending the right of women in the country.
Issue.Other: Key barriers stopping women from accessing information can be identified in options marked above (3,5,8,10,11 & 12).
Possible Solutions: Regarding the aspect of domestic activities holding back women from accessing information, I think they must be made aware of the power of information and educating their men on their rights to have free access to information. The same solution applies to the other problems highlighted.
Consequence of less awareness for women: As a consequence of lack of information, it could lead to backward society where women could be seen loosing rights to educated men
Rights.Please Explain: Women are as much part of society as men are. Therefore, they deserve to enjoy all of the above rights as much as men
Econ.Please Explain: Everyone, not just women, needs access to all the above in order to be self sufficient. The multiple ways listed above greatly help to capacitate an individual for economic growth.
Third Most Important: How to Get a Trade License
Anything Else: Women should be helped with capital to start up a business, and promotes individual capacitation, as an educated woman is an empowered one .
Enumerator Notes: The mindset of the respondent was clear when expressing his views and taught.
